alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 7:14PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Somerset, southwestern Wicomico, southwestern Worcester and Accomack Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 714 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Princess Anne to near Marion Station to near Willis Wharf. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Princess Anne around 720 PM EDT. University Of Maryland Eastern Shore around 725 PM EDT. Fruitland and West Pocomoke around 740 PM EDT. Pocomoke City and Salisbury University around 745 PM EDT. Salisbury around 750 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Hallwood, Melfa, Trinity, Cokesbury, Eden, Wallops Island, Nelsonia, Sanford, Modest Town and Longridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
